DataElement.preferredName: Pain Intensity Scale-Child Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability Scale Activity Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A child's stated response of activity pain intensity by using the Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability (FLACC) pain tool on a scale from 0 to 2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pain Intensity Scale-Child Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability Scale
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single interviewer-administered question for children aged 4- to 12-years-old assessing acute pain intensity. The item is measured on an 11-point scale.:A tool that assesses pain intensity in pre- and nonverbal individuals by utilizing a three-point scale to rate five categories (face, legs, activity, consolability, and cry) based on observation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A single interviewer-administered question for children aged 4- to 12-years-old assessing acute pain intensity. The item is measured on an 11-point scale.

Concepts.definition: A single interviewer-administered question for children aged 4- to 12-years-old assessing acute pain intensity. The item is measured on an 11-point scale.

Property.preferredName: Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability Scale
Property.preferredDefinition: A tool that assesses pain intensity in pre- and nonverbal individuals by utilizing a three-point scale to rate five categories (face, legs, activity, consolability, and cry) based on observation.

Concepts.longName: Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability Scale
Concepts.definition: A tool that assesses pain intensity in pre- and nonverbal individuals by utilizing a three-point scale to rate five categories (face, legs, activity, consolability, and cry) based on observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A single interviewer-administered question for children aged 4- to 12-years-old assessing acute pain intensity. The item is measured on an 11-point scale._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lying quietly, normal position, moves easily; regular, rhythmic respirations
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lying quietly, normal position, moves easily; regular, rhythmic respirations.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squirming, shifting back and forth, tense or guarded movements; mildly agitated (e.g., head back and forth, aggression); shallow, splinting respirations, intermittent sighs
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Squirming, shifting back and forth, tense or guarded movements; mildly agitated (e.g., head back and forth, aggression); shallow, splinting respirations, intermittent sighs.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Arched, rigid or jerking; severe agitation; head banging; shivering (not rigors); breath holding, gasping, or sharp intake of breaths, severe splinting
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Arched, rigid or jerking; severe agitation; head banging; shivering (not rigors); breath holding, gasping, or sharp intake of breaths, severe splinting.
